DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node T3 Stage Finding Involved Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to involved lymph node that is TNM finding usually indicating that the cancer is locally invasive, without infiltration of adjacent structures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node T3 Stage Finding Involved
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to involved lymph node that is TNM finding usually indicating that the cancer is locally invasive, without infiltration of adjacent structures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition:
A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding usually indicating that the cancer is locally invasive, without infiltration of adjacent structures.
:Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

Concepts.definition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding usually indicating that the cancer is locally invasive, without infiltration of adjacent structures.
Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
